identificationModule.briefTitle: Two weeks of twice-daily prism adaptation treatment does not improve posture or gait in Parkinson's disease
identificationModule.officialTitle: Two weeks of twice-daily prism adaptation treatment does not improve posture or gait in Parkinson's disease: a double-blind randomized controlled trial

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: The study had a double-blind randomized controlled design with two parallel groups. The intended allocation ratio was 1:1 (real:sham); however, the final allocation ratio was 1.38:1 due to a deviation from the intended allocation procedure.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The participants, and the researchers responsible for participant enrolment and assessing outcomes were all blinded as to which type of treatment each participant underwent. Participants were allocated to undergo real or sham prism adaptation through a sealed envelope-style blind draw. Regardless of treatment, the researcher stated that the goggles distorted vision. There was no difference in the percentage of people in each group who guessed the treatment that they had been assigned to in the post-treatment session.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in postural control measured by Berg Balance Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: 14-item test assessing static and dynamic balance. Performance on each item rated from 0 (lowest level of function) to 4 (highest level of function) with a total score out of 56.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in postural control measured by Limits of Stability test
primaryOutcomes.description: Measures ability to displace center of gravity relative to feet without losing balance or taking a step. Outcomes include reaction time, maximum movement velocity, and maximum extension of center of gravity over the feet.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in postural control measured by Sensory Organization Test
primaryOutcomes.description: Measures postural control under different somatosensory, visual, and vestibular feedback conditions. Provides composite equilibrium score and center of gravity alignment in forward-backward plane.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in postural control measured by Motor Control Test
primaryOutcomes.description: Assesses ability of automatic motor system to recover following unexpected external disturbance. Provides composite latency value (time in milliseconds between force plate translation and corrective responses).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in gait measured by Timed Up and Go test
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time (in seconds) for patient to stand up from seated position, walk 3 meters, turn around, walk back, and sit down.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in gait measured by Functional Gait Assessment
secondaryOutcomes.description: 10-item test assessing dynamic balance and postural stability during gait. Performance scored from 0 (severe impairment) to 3 (normal) for each item with total out of 30.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in gait measured by Walk Across test
secondaryOutcomes.description: Quantifies characteristics of steady state gait as patient walks across force plate. Average step length and speed recorded.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in freezing of gait measured by New Freezing of Gait Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: 9-item questionnaire evaluating impact and severity of freezing of gait on locomotion and daily activities. Items scored from 0 or 1 to 3 or 4, with total out of 28.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline (Day 1), 1 day post (Day 15), 1 week post (Week 3), 1 month post (Week 7), and 3 months post (Week 15)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in confidence measured by Falls Efficacy Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: 10-item questionnaire rating confidence in performing daily activities without falling. Responses from 0 (very confident) to 10 (not very confident) with total out of 100.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline (Day 1), 1 day post (Day 15), 1 week post (Week 3), 1 month post (Week 7), and 3 months post (Week 15)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in balance confidence measured by Activities-specific Balance Confidence Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: 16-item questionnaire rating confidence in not losing balance or becoming unsteady during specific activities. Responses from 0 to 100% in 10% increments. Average calculated.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline (Day 1), 1 day post (Day 15), 1 week post (Week 3), 1 month post (Week 7), and 3 months post (Week 15)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in health and daily function measured by Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire 39
secondaryOutcomes.description: 39-item questionnaire measuring Parkinson's disease-specific health and daily function. Participants rate extent of problems with mobility and self-care from 0 (never) to 4 (always). Percentage calculated for total and subscales.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline (Day 1), 1 day post (Day 15), 1 week post (Week 3), 1 month post (Week 7), and 3 months post (Week 15)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient-reported change measured by Patient's Global Impressions of Change
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patients rate change in activity limitations, symptoms, emotions, overall quality of life, freezing of gait, walking, and balance on 7-point Likert scale from 1 (no change) to 7 (a great deal better).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day post (Day 15), 1 week post (Week 3), 1 month post (Week 7), and 3 months post (Week 15)
